column1: Oiolairë was a Fragrant Trees that grew in Númenor
column2: and especially in the western region known as Nísimaldar. It was the custom among Númenóreans mariners to place a cut bough of oiolairë on the prows of their ships
column3: called the Green Bough of Return
column4: as a symbol of good fortune.

column1: The word oiolairë means "Ever-summer" in Quenya (from oio= "endless period" and lairë= "summer").
